channel.title: I need help please.Please help me, i am in need of help
channel.description:
Ok first things is first. I cannot get onto silab or any other client, without he cache file from moparscape cache.
Everytime i sart the client it says it does not know whether javac is an exernal or internal batch file.
But even when it does load, the downloading of the cache.zip for silab/moparscape.zip cache begins, and then it stops at 3%.
I would have posted pictures , but i do no know if i am alllowed to.

item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

You mentioned something about the cache? try dling this: Click here then extract it to “C:\WINDOWS.mpr_file_store_32” folder, I got it from the moparscape questions section on the Tutorial the God of Ikiliki did… because you know when you try to load the moparscape client, it says downloading cache right? It’s probably because your automatic cache download thing is messed up… so it should fix it…

item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

Okay, here’s a test to see if you have JDK installed correctly… goto: command prompt, which is in accessories on the startup, or you can click on the run… then type cmd.
Now, once you have commands prompt open, type: javac, what does it come up with?

item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

You need JAVA JDK… then you need to set the environmental variables… kinda complicated. pm me, I’ll explain everything… I just got done writing a tut… I’m kinda tired…[br][size=1]Posted on: October 20, 2007, 01:12:52 PM[/size][hr]you mentioned that you have already set up the classpath and path on environmental variables, but the question is, did you do it right???

item.source: I need help please.Please help me, i am in need of help

item.title: I need help please.Please help me, i am in need of help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Paths
ok wen every u run serten stuff the item ur running is foloing a path umm like lets say you click to compile a server the server compiler needs a path to the jdk wich normally is in the program files/java/jdk update 3 but different
hreres how you make paths,class path for update 3

first of all go to the start menu find my computer
the click it you will see option on the side of the window,left side very top
says “view system information” click on that now u see a smaller window click the tab that says advanced now at the bottem click enviorment verables now u see the first option that says new click it

now type path as the verable now as the value add this

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin;.;
ok now click done or ok what ever it says now click new again now name the veriable classpath
and for the value add this

 CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

and your done =)
to check your work go to the run option on the start menu and type cmd now in the black box rype javac if a bunch of stuff pops up usually means ur good =)[br][size=1]Posted on: October 20, 2007, 01:11:12 PM[/size][hr]well on some computers like mine at the end of the path you have to have the ;.; i dont know why but its there lol

Read full topic
